desc_content.paragraph: Bases: object
Provisioning Class for Dell EMC VMAX volume drivers.
It supports VMAX arrays.
Break the rdf relationship between a pair of devices.

list_item.paragraph: state – the state of the rdf pair

desc_content.paragraph: Unlink a snapshot from its target volume.

list_item.paragraph: snap_name – the name for the snap shot

desc_content.paragraph: Create a replica (snapVx) of a volume group.

list_item.paragraph: snap_name – the name for the snap shot

desc_content.paragraph: Create a new storage group.
Create a new volume in the given storage group.
Create a generic volume group.

list_item.paragraph: group_name – the name of the group

desc_content.paragraph: Create a snap vx of a source and copy to a target.

list_item.paragraph: snap_name – the name for the snap shot

desc_content.paragraph: Create a snapVx of a volume.
Delete the snapshot.

list_item.paragraph: snap_name – the name for the snap shot

desc_content.paragraph: Delete the temporary snapshot created for clone operations.

There can be instances where the source and target both attempt to delete a temp snapshot simultaneously, so we must lock the snap and then double check it is on the array. :param array: the array serial number :param snap_name: the snapshot name :param source_device_id: the source device id
Delete a volume from the srp.
Delete a snapVx snapshot of a volume.
Check if a snap has any links before deletion.

If a snapshot has any links, break the replication relationship before deletion. :param array: the array serial number :param snap_name: the snapshot name :param source_device: the source device id :param extra_specs: the extra specifications
Extend a volume.
Failover or back a volume pair.

list_item.paragraph: failover – flag to indicate failover or failback – bool

desc_content.paragraph: Get or create a generic volume group.
Get or create a volume group.

Sometimes it may be necessary to recreate a volume group on the backend - for example, when the last member volume has been removed from the group, but the cinder group object has not been deleted. :param array: the array serial number :param group: the group object :param extra_specs: the extra specifications :return: group name
Get slo and workload settings from a storage group.
Get the srp capacity stats.
Links a group snap and breaks the relationship.
Check if SLO and workload values are valid.

list_item.paragraph: slo – Service Level Object e.g bronze
srp – the storage resource pool name
